2ft In looking over the advance program of the Workshop, I was impressed by the variety
of subjects to be presented,, Truly, I looked forward to it* And I was not dis¬
appointed by a single item. The several demonstrations on lighting, the wealth of
material on Kinescope Recording, etc*, were all very helpful.
3* Depending on the kind of people who would make up the Workshop, actual operation
may or might not be of particular value to the member. When a group of 2$ people
is involved, smaller groups of 5 or 6 could perhaps be handled easily, if there
were some other activity in which the remainder could participate.
lj. The way in which the workshop was conducted was, I thought, very good. There was
some comment on the part of others that "it was a long day from 8:00 A.M. to 10:00
P.M." but after all, that is to be expected when attending a "workshop,," When the
program tries to encompass that amount of material in so short a time, the day has
to be made that long in order to fully cover the agenda. Sure, it would have been
nice to have had time to "take in the sights" but that was not the intent and pur-
pose of this session.
Sc The way in which the NAEB Engineering Service could help our organization would be
such as this: If we could have the benefit of Mr. Bialack5s know-how gained by
visiting the many Educational TV stations throughout the country, in helping us lay
out our studios & related space* But perhaps this is not the function of the NAEB
TV Engineer,. I think that the Engineering Newsletter, with its "Helpful Hints"
is good. But we do not have the budget or the time to see how the other fellow is
doing the sems thing we are trying to do. We did a lot of pioneering in FM in the
early days, had no one to follow, but with TV, with its diversity of space require¬
ments etc., is something that is made easiei* by someone who has been around the many
other completed stations.
In conclusion, I wish to state that I did get a lot out of attending the Workshop,
both from the lectures and the "bull sessions" afterward, and in talking to indi¬
vidual members-
I want to take this opportunity to thank those whose generosity made it possible for

When I was first approached on the topic of attending the Workshop, I must admit I had
little enthusiasm for the idea. In fact, to be perfectly honest, J was "agin" it. How«
ever, after due consideration, I decided to attend.
I must confess I expected very little when I packed my toothbrush and "other" pair of
socks and set off for Michigan State and operation "Workshop." Thus, it was quite a
pleasant shock to find the well organized and enlightening program presented there.
The speakers did a tremendous job with their presentations. A great number of the
topics covered situations now prevailing in our own operations and provided a base for
future progress.
One other thing I appreciated greatly and valued highly was the chance to meet and talk
"Shop" with other engineers. From these talks I learned a great maiy technical points
and regained some enthusiasm for the business.
